[[Benjamín Moreno]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, 2020 deaths, Spanish footballers, Deaths from heart failure

Benjamín Moreno (17 April 1955 – 1 May 2020), known simply as Moreno, was a Spanish footballer. He played as striker. From 1980 to 1985, he played for CD Leganés. Moreno was born in Guarromán, Spain.

Moreno died in Madrid of heart failure on 1 May 2020, aged 55.

[[In a Lonely Place]]

CATEGORIES: 1950 drama movies, 1950s romantic drama movies, American romantic drama movies, Movies directed by Nicholas Ray, Film noir

In a Lonely Place is a 1950 American romantic drama movie directed by Nicholas Ray and based on the 1947 novel of the same name by Dorothy B. Hughes. It stars Humphrey Bogart, Gloria Grahame, Frank Lovejoy, Martha Stewart, Robert Warwick and was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[RNA vaccine]]

CATEGORIES: Infectious diseases, Virology, Immunization

Messenger RNA vaccines or mRNA vaccines is a type of vaccine that protects the body from certain viruses. Like all vaccines, mRNA vaccines increase the body's immunity so the patient is less likely to catch an infectious disease.

[[Harriet Craig]]

CATEGORIES: 1950 drama movies, American drama movies, Movies based on plays, Movies directed by Vincent Sherman

Harriet Craig is a 1950 American film noir drama movie directed by Vincent Sherman and based on the 1925 play Craig's Wife by George Kelly. It stars Joan Crawford, Wendell Corey, Allyn Joslyn, Lucile Watson and was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[Carl Værnet]]

CATEGORIES: 1893 births, 1965 deaths, Danish people, SS officers, Holocaust perpetrators

Carl Vaernet (born: April 28, 1893 in Copenhagen, Denmark, died on November 25, 1965, Buenos Aires, Argentina) was a doctor in the Buchenwald concentration camp.  He is infamous for doing barbaric medical experiments on gay prisoners. The these crimes were hidden from history for over 50 years. 

With help from the British military, he was not put on trial at Nuremburg. He escaped to Argentina where he is known to have lived openly until his death in 1965.

[[The Marrying Kind]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 comedy movies, 1952 drama movies, American comedy-drama movies, Movies directed by George Cukor, Movies about divorce

The Marrying Kind is a 1952 American comedy drama movie directed by George Cukor and starring Judy Holliday, Aldo Ray, Ruth Gordon, Charles Bronson, Frank Ferguson, Madge Kennedy. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[Astarte]]

CATEGORIES: Gods and goddesses

Astarte (Ashtoreth, also spelled Athtart, Ashtoreth, or Ashtart) is the Queen of Heaven to whom the Canaanites burned offerings and poured libations (Jeremiah 44). Astarte, goddess of war and sexual love, shared so many qualities with her sister, Anath, that they may originally have been seen as a single deity. Their names together are the basis for the Aramaic goddess Atargatis.

Astarte was a great goddess of the ancient Middle East and chief deity of Tyre, Sidon, and Elat, important Mediterranean seaports. Hebrew scholars now feel that the goddess Ashtoreth mentioned so often in the Bible is a deliberate conflation of the Greek name Astarte and the Hebrew word boshet, “shame,” indicating the Hebrews’ contempt for her cult. Ashtaroth, the plural form of the goddess’s name in Hebrew, became a general term denoting goddesses and paganism.

Astarte was worshiped in Egypt and Ugarit and among the Hittites, as well as in Canaan. Her Akkadian counterpart was Ishtar. Later she became assimilated with the Egyptian deities Isis and Hathor (a goddess of the sky and of women), and in the Greco-Roman world with Aphrodite, Artemis, and Juno.

Astarte is a Semitic queen, and sister of Isis.

[[Young Jesse James]]

CATEGORIES: 1960 movies, 1960s western movies, American western movies, Movies directed by William F. Claxton

Young Jesse James is 1960 American western movie directed by William F. Claxton and stars Ray Stricklyn, Merry Anders, Robert Dix, Emile Meyer, Willard Parker, Rayford Barnes, Tyler McVey. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Cymose]]

CATEGORIES: Plants

Cymose inflorescence (cyme) is a type of flowering shoot. The first inflorescence develops from the growing region at the top of the flower stalk. The younger shoots flower on the sides. 

[[Hell and High Water (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 drama movies, American drama movies, 20th Century Fox movies, Movies directed by Samuel Fuller

Hell and High Water is a 1954 American Cold War drama movie directed by Samuel Fuller and stars Richard Widmark, Bella Darvi, Victor Francen, Cameron Mitchell, David Wayne. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox and was nominated for an Academy Award in 1955.

[[2008 United States presidential election in Texas]]

The 2008 United States presidential election in Texas occurred on November 4 2008 as part of, that year's national election. John McCain won the election, winning the state's 34 electoral votes.

[[2008 United States presidential election in North Carolina]]

The 2008 United States presidential election in North Carolina took place as part of that year's national presidential election, This election took place on November 4, 2008. Barack Obama won, becoming the first Democrat to win North Carolina since Jimmy Carter in 1976. Obama was very narrowly elected, winning 49.7% of the vote. John McCain received 49.38% of the vote.

Scott, Jeanne Moreau, Art Carney, Edmund Purdom, Roland Culver, Riccardo Garrone. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and was nominated for 2 BAFTAS.

[[The Quiet Man]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 comedy movies, 1952 drama movies, 1950s romantic comedy movies, 1950s romantic drama movies, American romantic comedy movies, American romantic drama movies, Irish movies, Movies based on short stories, Movies directed by John Ford

The Quiet Man is a 1952 American romantic comedy drama movie directed by John Ford and based on the 1933 short story of the same name by Maurice Walsh. It stars John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Barry Fitzgerald, Ward Bond, Victor McLaglen, Eileen Crowe, Mildred Natwick, Jack MacGowran and was distributed by Warner Bros.. It was nominated for 7 Oscars and won 2 at the Academy Awards in 1953.

[[Prescription for Murder]]

CATEGORIES: 1958 movies, 1950s crime movies, American crime movies, British crime movies

Prescription for Murder, also known as Rx Murder, is a 1958 American British crime movie directed by Derek Twist and based on the 1955 novel The Deeds of Dr. Deadcert by Joan Fleming. It stars Rick Jason, Lisa Gastoni, Marius Goring, Vida Hope, Nicholas Hannen, Frederick Leister, Patrick Waddington and was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Blood Beach]]

[[Samuel Rivera]]

CATEGORIES: 1946 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from stroke, American mayors, American criminals, People from Passaic, New Jersey, Politicians from New Jersey, US Democratic Party politicians

Samuel Rivera (1946 – May 1, 2020) was an American politician and criminal. He was a member of the Democratic Party. He was Mayor of Passaic, New Jersey from 2001 until 2008. 

On September 6, 2007, Rivera was indicted and arrested on charges of accepting bribes.  Rivera pleaded guilty to attempted extortion and resigned. He was sentenced to 21 months in prison. 

Rivera died on May 1, 2020 of problems caused by multiple strokes, aged 73.

[[The Zodiac Killer]]

CATEGORIES: 1971 thriller movies, 1970s serial killer movies, American thriller movies, American independent movies

The Zodiac Killer is a 1971 American thriller movie directed by Tom Hanson and stars Hal Reed, Bob Jones, Ray Lynch, Tom Pittman.

[[Ludwig (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1973 drama movies, 1970s LGBT movies, Italian drama movies, German drama movies, French drama movies, Movies directed by Luchino Visconti

Ludwig is a 1973 Italian French German biographical drama movie directed by Luchino Visconti and starring Helmut Berger, Romy Schneider, Trevor Howard, Silvana Mangano, Gert Fröbe, Helmut Griem, John Moulder-Brown, Heinz Moog.

[[Natalie Harrowell]]

CATEGORIES: 1990 births, 2019 deaths, British rugby league players

Natalie Harrowell (9 February 1990 – 10 December 2019) was an English rugby league player who played in the first-ever Women's Super League Grand Final in 2017. Harrowell played for Featherstone Rovers and was regarded as a "key member of the women's club team", she also held 3 caps for England Rugby League. She was admitted to the hospital with a virus and died during December 2019.

[[That Cold Day in the Park]]

CATEGORIES: 1969 drama movies, Canadian drama movies, Movies directed by Robert Altman, Movies based on books, American independent movies

That Cold Day in the Park is a 1969 Canadian suspense drama movie directed by Robert Altman and based on novel of the same name by Peter Miles. It stars Sandy Dennis, Michael Burns, Linda Sorenson, Susanne Benton, Luana Anders, Michael Murphy.

[[Thief (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1981 movies, 1980s crime thriller movies, American crime thriller movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Michael Mann

Thief is a 1981 crime thriller movie directed by Michael Mann and based on the 1975 novel The Home Invaders: Confessions of a Cat Burglar by Frank Hohimer. It stars James Caan, Tuesday Weld, Willie Nelson, James Belushi, Robert Prosky, William Petersen and was distributed by United Artists.

[[Travels with My Aunt (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1970s adventure movies, 1972 comedy movies, American adventure movies, American comedy movies, Movies directed by George Cukor, Movies based on books

Travels with My Aunt is a 1972 American adventure comedy movie directed by George Cukor and based on the 1969 novel of the same name by Graham Greene. It stars Maggie Smith, Alec McCowen, Louis Gossett Jr., Cindy Williams, Robert Flemyng and was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. It was nominated for 4 Oscars and won an Academy Award in 1973.

[[Bashu, the Little Stranger]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 drama movies, Iranian movies, Movies directed by Bahram Beizai

Bashu, the Little Stranger (باشو غریبه کوچک) is a 1986 Iranian drama movie directed by Bahram Beizai and starring Susan Taslimi, Parviz Poorhosseini. It was considered at the best film of the 1980's in Iranian cinema.

[[Heena Shahab]]

CATEGORIES: Living people, People from Bihar, Indian politicians, 1976 births

Heena Shahab is an Indian politician from the state of Bihar. She is a member of the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) political party and wife of the Indin politician Mohammad Shahabuddin, a former member of parliament from Siwan district. Shahab is the current Leader of Opposition from Siwan Lok Sabha constituency.

[[Zealot]]

CATEGORIES: Jewish people

The Zealots were a group of Jews who lived about the same time as Jesus. The wanted to defeat the Romans, who were the rulers of Palestine at that time. They used violence to meet their goals. One of the Twelve Apostles of Jesus, named Simon, was a Zealot. The word "zealot" (not written with a capital letter) in modern English is used for any person who has a very strong idea about things and works hard to act upon their ideas. There are political and religious zealots but people can be "zealous" about other things also.

[[Operation Crossbow]]

CATEGORIES: 1965 thriller movies, British thriller movies, Movies directed by Michael Anderson

Operation Crossbow later re-released as The Great Spy Mission is a 1965 British World War II thriller movie directed by Michael Anderson and starring Sophia Loren, George Peppard, Trevor Howard, John Mills, Jeremy Kemp, Anthony Quayle, Tom Courtenay, Sylvia Syms, Maurice Denham, Richard Todd, Allan Cuthbertson. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

[[Great Commission]]

CATEGORIES: Christianity, Jesus Christ

Gospel JesusThe Great Commission in Christian belief is something that Jesus told his followers. This happened after His resurrection. Jesus told his Twelve Apostles to go all over the world and tell everyone about Him. The most well known version of the Great Commission is in Matthew 28:16 to 20. Jesus meets his followers on a mountain in Galilee. He tells them to make disciples of and baptize everyone in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Spirit.

Earlier Jesus had sent out 70 of his followers to preach and heal, but only to the Jews. However, Jesus himself had healed some non-Jewish people before. At the beginning of his public work, Jesus spoke to His own people. After rising from the dead, he made it clear that His message was for everyone. This "commission" is very important to missionaries who believe that God wants them to go to every country in the world and preach about Jesus.

[[Montillières-sur-Orne]]

CATEGORIES: 2019 establishments in France, Communes in Calvados

Montillières-sur-Orne is a commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2019 and consists of the former communes of Trois-Monts (the seat) and Goupillières.

[[Noues de Sienne]]

CATEGORIES: 2017 establishments in France, Communes in Calvados

Noues de Sienne is a commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2017 and consists of the former communes of Saint-Sever-Calvados (the seat), Champ-du-Boult, Courson, Fontenermont, Le Gast, Le Mesnil-Benoist, Le Mesnil-Caussois, Mesnil-Clinchamps, Saint-Manvieu-Bocage and Sept-Frères.

[[Noyers-Missy]]

CATEGORIES: 2016 establishments in France, 21st century disestablishments in France, 2010s disestablishments in Europe, 2017 disestablishments, Former communes in Calvados

Noyers-Missy was a short-lived commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2016 and consists of the former communes of Noyers-Bocage (the seat) and Missy. On 1 January 2017, it was merged into the new commune of Val d'Arry.

[[Miracles of Jesus]]

CATEGORIES: Gospels, Jesus Christ

The miracles of Jesus are things the Bible and Qur'an say that Jesus did, that a person normally cannot do. Followers of those religions say, that Jesus did those things by the power of God.

The Gospels of Matthew, Mark and Luke record many of these stories. The most common ones are healing people who are sick, blind, lame or deaf. In many cases, the sicknesses or other problems are said to be caused by demons. Jesus said, that he had power over the demons, and so He could stop their evil work. The enemies of Jesus told him to do miracles to show, that He had supernatural power, but He refused. However, for his followers, he did several miracles that showed His power. These included stopping a storm in the sea, walking on water and making a tree die.

In Islam, Jesus is said to have spoken from his cradle, made a clay bird come alive, and brought down from heaven a table full of food. Both the Qur'an and the Christian New Testament say, that Jesus brought some dead people back to life.

In the Gospel of John, only seven miracles are mentioned. John calls them "signs". Their purpose was to teach something about the power of Jesus, not just to help people. Two of the greatest miracles recorded are the Virgin birth of Jesus and the resurrection. The Qur'an also mentions the Virgin birth, but not the resurrection.

Gospel JesusThroughout history, many Christians have said that they have been healed by Jesus. Roman Catholic believers have many such stories. Some places, such as Lourdes, are places where sick people go to be healed by Jesus. Other Christians say that Jesus has healed them or done other miracles at large Christian meetings. Other Christians think that Jesus only did such things when he was on Earth. They do not believe that such miracles happen today.

[[Tumbleweed]]

CATEGORIES: Plants

Several plant species that grow in arid, steppe-like environments use the wind to propagate. The structure that is pushed by the wind is usually called tumbleweed. This structure will detatch from its root or stem and will roll on the ground. In most such species, the tumbleweed consists of the whole plant apart from the root system. Sometimes,  only  a hollow fruit or inflorescence detaches. Tumbleweed species occur most commonly in steppe and arid ecosystems, where  frequent wind and the open environment permit rolling easly.

Most  tissues of the tumbleweed structure are dead.  This needs to be the case,  because the structure needs to degrade and fall apart so that its seeds or spores can escape during the tumbling. Sometimes they  germinate after the tumbleweed has come to rest in a wet location. In this case, many species of tumbleweed open mechanically, releasing their seeds as they swell when they absorb water.

The tumbleweed diaspore disperses seeds. This stategy is not limited to the seed plants; some species of spore-bearing cryptogams—such as Selaginella—form tumbleweeds, and some fungi that resemble puffballs dry out, break free of their attachments and are similarly tumbled by the wind, dispersing spores as they go.

[[Oliver Ortmann]]

CATEGORIES: 1967 births, Living people, Sportspeople from Hamburg, Cue sports players

Oliver Ortmann (born 11 June 1967) is a German pool player from Gelsenkirchen. Ortmann is a three-time world champion, winning the 1995 WPA World Nine-ball Championship and both the 2007 and 2010 Straight pool world championships. With 14 wins, he is one of the best players at the European Pool Championships. Ortmann is the second to Ralf Souquet on the Euro Tour, winning 14 events. Ortmann was the first player from Europe to win the U.S. Open Straight Pool Championship, in 1989.

He has been on Europe's team 8 times in the Mosconi Cup from 1994 to 2004. He was on the winning side in 1995 and 2002. With 44 German national medals, Ortmann is one of the best German pool players ever. In 1996, he was the first cue sports player to receive the Silbernes Lorbeerblatt, the highest sporting award given in Germany. Ortmann was put into the Straight Pool Hall of Fame in an August 2013 ceremony in New York City. The following year, he was entered into the Billiard Congress of America's Hall of Fame.

[[Open Season (1974 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1974 thriller movies, 1970s serial killer movies, British thriller movies, Spanish movies, Movies based on books

Open Season is a 1974 British Spanish thriller movie. It was directed by Peter Collinson. It is based on the book by David Osborn. Actors include Peter Fonda, Cornelia Sharpe, John Phillip Law, Alberto de Mendoza, and William Holden. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[Dirty Mary, Crazy Larry]]

CATEGORIES: 1974 movies, 1970s action movies, American action movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by John Hough

Dirty Mary, Crazy Larry is a 1974 American action movie. It was directed by John Hough. The movie is based on the 1963 book The Chase by Richard Unekis. Actors include Peter Fonda, Susan George, Adam Roarke, Vic Morrow, and Kenneth Tobey. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Golden birdwing]]

CATEGORIES: Papilionidae

The golden birdwing (Troides aeacus) is a large tropical butterfly. It belongs in the family Papilionidae. It is found in Northeastern India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Burma, China, Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, Taiwan, Cambodia, peninsular Malaysia and Indonesia.

[[Hustle (1975 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1975 movies, 1970s crime movies, 1975 mystery movies, American mystery movies, Movies directed by Robert Aldrich

Hustle is a 1975 American crime movie. It was directed by Robert Aldrich. Actors include Burt Reynolds, Catherine Deneuve, Paul Winfield, Eddie Albert, Ernest Borgnine, Eileen Brennan, and Ben Johnson. It was distributed by Paramount Pictures.

[[Vincent van der Burg]]

CATEGORIES: 1945 births, 2020 deaths, Catholic People's Party politicians, Christian Democratic Appeal politicians, Dutch lawyers, Dutch Roman Catholics, Former members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands, People from Zeist, Politicians from Utrecht (province)

Vincent Arthur Maria van der Burg (17 April 1945 – 29 April 2020) was a Dutch lawyer and politician. Van der Burg was born in Zeist. He was a member of the KVP, later changed into CDA. He was a member of Dutch House of Representatives from 1979 to 1998 (with interruptions in 1981 and 1982).

Van den Burg died in Zeist on 29 April 2020, aged 75.

[[Take a Hard Ride]]

CATEGORIES: 1975 movies, Italian movies, American western movies

Take a Hard Ride is a 1975 Italian American western movie. It was directed by Antonio Margheriti. Actors include Jim Brown, Lee Van Cleef, Fred Williamson, Jim Kelly, Dana Andrews, Barry Sullivan, Robert Donner, and Harry Carey, Jr. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Jan-Olof Strandberg]]

CATEGORIES: 1926 births, 2020 deaths, Swedish movie actors, Swedish stage actors, Actors from Stockholm

Jan-Olof Strandberg (9 September 1926 – 2 May 2020) was a Swedish actor. He appeared in 45 movies, beginning in 1947. His best known stage role was as Vladimir in Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot. He appeared in Erland Josephson's play Blomsterplockarna ("The Flower Pickers") at Dramaten. 

His best known movie roles were in Wild Birds (1955), Last Pair Out (1956), Ön (1966), Varning för Jönssonligan (1981), Flight of the Eagle (1982), Resan till Melonia (1989) and Faithless (2000).

Strandberg was born in Stockholm. He died on 2 May 2020, aged 93.

[[Ajay Kumar Tripathi]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in India, Indian politicians, Indian judges

Ajay Kumar Tripathi (12 November 1957 – 2 May 2020) was an Indian judge. He was a Judicial Member of Lokpal from 23 March 2019 until his death. He was also the Chief Justice of Chhattisgarh High Court from 7 July 2018 to 22 March 2019. Tripathi was born in Bihar. 

On 5 April 2020, Tripathi was diagnosed with COVID-19. He died in New Delhi on 2 May 2020 from the infection, aged 62.

[[Roger Horchow]]

CATEGORIES: 1928 births, 2020 deaths, Cancer deaths in Texas, Theatre producers, Businesspeople from Cincinnati, Ohio

Samuel Roger Horchow (July 3, 1928 – May 2, 2020) was an American theatre producer and businessman. He was born in Cincinnati, Ohio. In 1992, he produced his first Broadway show, Crazy for You, for which he won the Tony Award for Best Musical. He also produced versions of Kiss Me, Kate, Curtains and Gypsy.

Horchow died in Dallas, Texas on May 2, 2020 of cancer, aged 91.

[[The Quiet Gun]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 movies, 1950s western movies, American western movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by William F. Claxton

The Quiet Gun is a 1957 American western movie. It was directed by William F. Claxton. The movie is based on the 1955 book Lawman by Lauran Paine. Actors include Forrest Tucker, Mara Corday, Jim Davis, Lee Van Cleef, and Kathleen Crowley. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Parliament of Catalonia]]

CATEGORIES: Politics of Spain, Catalonia

The Parliament of Catalonia (Parlament de Catalunya, pəɾləˈmen də kətəˈluɲə; Parlamento de Cataluña; Parlament de Catalonha) is the unicameral legislature of the autonomous community of Catalonia. It is made-up of 135 deputies (diputats/deputats/diputados), who are elected every four years. The Parliament building is located in Ciutadella Park, Barcelona.

The most recent parliamentary elections were held on 21 December 2017. October 1st independence referendum results, the Parliament of Catalonia declared independence from Spain on 27 October 2017 with a vote of 70–10. In response, Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy dissolved the Parliament and called for a snap regional election.

[[África Lorente Castillo]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Spain, Moroccan politicians, Political activists, Politicians from Barcelona

África Lorente Castillo (16 October 1954 – 1 May 2020) was a Moroccan-born Spanish politician and activist. She was born in Tangier, Morocco. She was a member of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party. Lorente Castillo was a supporter of Catalan independence. 

She was a member of the Catalan Parliament from 1984 to 1988. From 1987 to 2003, she was Deputy Mayor of Castelldefels.

Lorente Castillo died of COVID-19 on 1 May 2020 in Castelldefels, aged 65.

[[No Down Payment]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 drama movies, American drama movies, Movies based on books, 20th Century Fox movies, Movies directed by Martin Ritt

No Down Payment is a 1957 American drama movie. It was directed by Martin Ritt. The movie is based on the book of the same name by John McPartland. Actors include Joanne Woodward, Sheree North, Tony Randall, Jeffrey Hunter, Cameron Mitchell, and Barbara Rush. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Castelldefels]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Catalonia, Municipalities in Catalonia

Castelldefels (kəsˌteʎdəˈfɛls) is a city in the Baix Llobregat comarca, in the province of Barcelona in Catalonia, Spain, and part of the Metropolitan Area of Barcelona. Its population was 65,954 in 2017.

[[8 Million Ways to Die]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 action movies, 1986 crime movies, 1986 thriller movies, 1980s crime thriller movies, American crime thriller movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Hal Ashby

8 Million Ways to Die is a 1986 American crime thriller movie. It was directed by Hal Ashby and produced by Oliver Stone. The movie is based on the book of the same name by Lawrence Block. Actors include Jeff Bridges, Andy Garcia, Rosanna Arquette, James Avery, Randy Brooks, and Alexandra Paul. It was distributed by TriStar Pictures.

[[The Enemy Below]]

The Enemy Below is a 1957 American World War II adventure movie. It was directed by Dick Powell. The movie is based on the book of the same name by Denys Rayner. It stars Robert Mitchum, Curt Jürgens, Theodore Bikel, and Frank Albertson. It won an Academy Award in 1958.

[[Simon Schenk]]

CATEGORIES: 1946 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from stroke, Deaths from surgical complications, Swiss politicians, Swiss sportspeople

Simon Schenk (16 May 1946 – 1 May 2020) was a Swiss politician. He was born in Langnau im Emmental, Switzerland. He was a member of the Swiss People's Party. 

Schenk was a member of the National Council from 1994 to 2001. He represented the Canton of Bern.

He was also the coach of the Switzerland men's national ice hockey team.

Schenk died on 1 May 2020 of a stroke caused by heart surgery in Bern, aged 73.

[[Hit Man (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1982 action movies, Mexican movies, Spanish movies

Hit Man is a 1982 Spanish Mexican action movie. It was directed by José Antonio de la Loma. Actors include George Peppard, Max von Sydow, Jorge Rivero, Maud Adams, and Chuck Connors.

[[Idir]]

CATEGORIES: 1949 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from pulmonary fibrosis, Algerian people, Singer-songwriters, Guitarists

Hamid Cheriet (in Kabyle language Ḥamid Ceryat; 25 October 1949 – 2 May 2020), better known by his stage name Idir or Yidir, was an Algerian singer-songwriter and guitarist He was born in Beni Yenni, Algeria. His best known album was A Vava Inouva (1976). His best known single was "Pourquoi cette pluie?" (2002). 

Idir died on 2 May 2020 in Paris of pulmonary fibrosis at the age of 70.

[[Matt Keough]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 births, 2020 deaths, American League All-Stars, Baseball players from California, Chicago Cubs players, Houston Astros players, New York Yankees players, Oakland Athletics players, St. Louis Cardinals players

Matthew Lon Keough ˈ (July 3, 1955 – May 1, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He was born in Pomona, California.

He played in Major League Baseball (MLB) as a right-handed pitcher for the Oakland Athletics (1977–1983), New York Yankees (1983–1984), St. Louis Cardinals (1985), Chicago Cubs (1986) and Houston Astros (1986). From 1987 to 1990, he played for the Japanese baseball team Hanshin Tigers.

Keough died on May 1, 2020 at the age of 64.

[[Megan Pormer]]

Megan Pormer is an iranian model, actress, doctor, television personality and cancer activist who has won Miss Dubai in 2019. She has been appeared in many magazine's cover including Cosmo, Vogue and Elle Arabia.   

[[Creully sur Seulles]]

CATEGORIES: 2017 establishments in France, Communes in Calvados

Creully sur Seulles is a commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2017 and consists of the former communes of Creully (the seat), Saint-Gabriel-Brécy and Villiers-le-Sec.

[[Ajitke Chattha]]

CATEGORIES: Gujranwala Division

Ajitke Chattha also spell as Ajit Kay Chattha and Ajitkay Chattha is a small village located in Wazirabad Tehsil, Gujranwala District, Punjab, Pakistan.

Ajitke Chattha has a population of over 1,100 and is located about 34.5 kilometres northwest of Gujranwala city via Kalaske Cheema-Gujranwala road. The population is over 100% Muslim. Most people in the village speak Punjabi, though almost all of them can also speak the national language of Pakistan, Urdu. English is spoken by the educated elite in the Ajitke Chattha. For all basic needs, people of Ajitke Chattha visit the nearest town Ali Pur Chatta. While No any facility is available in village else middle level education.

[[Saline, Calvados]]

CATEGORIES: 2017 establishments in France, 21st century disestablishments in France, 2010s disestablishments in Europe, 2019 disestablishments, Former communes in Calvados

Saline was a short-lived commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2017 and consists of the former communes of Troarn (the seat) and Sannerville. This merger was revoked by the administrative court, and on 31 December 2019 the former communes Troarn and Sannerville were recreated.

[[Mainpuri]]

CATEGORIES: Cities and towns in Uttar Pradesh

Mainpuri is the city in Mainpuri district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It is the administrative headquarters of Mainpuri district and is situated to the north-east of Agra and is 270 km from New Delhi. Mainpuri forms part of ancient legendary region of Lord Krishna's land called Braj.

[[The Strange One]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 drama movies, American drama movies, Movies based on books

[[Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea]]

CATEGORIES: 1961 movies, 1960s science fiction movies, American science fiction movies, Movies with underwater settings, 20th Century Fox movies, Movies directed by Irwin Allen

Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea is a 1961 American science fiction movie. It was directed by Irwin Allen. Actors include Walter Pidgeon, Robert Sterling, Peter Lorre, Joan Fontaine, Barbara Eden, Michael Ansara, and Frankie Avalon. In 1964, a TV series was made based on the movie. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[A Face in the Crowd]]

[[A Generation]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 drama movies, 1950s war movies, Polish movies, World War II movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Andrzej Wajda

A Generation (Pokolenie) is a 1955 Polish World War II drama movie. It was directed by Andrzej Wajda. It is based on the book Pokolenie by Bohdan Czeszko. Actors include Tadeusz Łomnicki, Urszula Modrzyńska, Tadeusz Janczar, Ryszard Kotys, and Roman Polanski. 

This was the first movie of the "Three Wars" trilogy by director Andrzej Wajda. It was followed by Kanal and Ashes and Diamonds. 

[[Changsha Metro]]

CATEGORIES: Rapid transit systems, China

The Changsha Metro (officially s=; also called s=) is a rapid transit system in Changsha, which is the capital of Hunan province in China. The first metro line of it, Line 2, was opened on April 29, 2014. This made Changsha the 18th city in mainland China to open a rapid transit system.As of May 2020, three additional lines of it are under construction.

[[From Here to Eternity]]

From Here to Eternity is a 1953 American World War II romantic drama movie. It was directed by Fred Zinnemann. The movie is based on the novel of the same name by James Jones. Actors include Frank Sinatra, Deborah Kerr, Donna Reed, Montgomery Clift, Burt Lancaster, Ernest Borgnine, Jack Warden, Philip Ober, and Mickey Shaughnessy. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures. It was nominated for 13 Oscars and won 8 Academy Awards in 1954.

It was based on the real life Luther Kelly.

[[Western Plateau]]

CATEGORIES: Geography of Australia, Regions of Australia

The Western Plateau (sometimes referred to as the Australian Shield), is Australia's largest drainage division and is composed predominantly of the remains of the ancient rock shield of Gondwana. It covers two thirds of the continent; 2,700,000 square kilometres of arid land including large parts of Western Australia, South Australia, and the Northern Territory. For comparison, it is roughly the same size as the whole of continental Europe from Poland to Portugal. 

Rain rarely falls in this region and aside from a handful of permanent waterholes, surface water is absent at all times except after heavy rain. Most of the territory is flat sandy or stony desert with a sparse covering of shrubs or tussock grasses. Average rainfall varies from one area to another and is quoted at 100 to 350 mm per year (between 4 and 14 inches) but is highly unpredictable.

There are no permanent watercourses. The general trend is for run-off to flow inland, but there is insufficient rainfall to produce any marked drainage pattern.

[[Calvert County, Maryland]]

Calvert County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 88,737. Its county seat is Prince Frederick.

[[Damascus University]]

CATEGORIES: 1920s establishments in Asia, 1923 establishments, Colleges and universities in Asia, Damascus

The University of Damascus (جامعة دمشق, Jāmi‘atu Dimashq) is the largest and oldest university in Syria, located in the capital Damascus  and has campuses in other Syrian cities. It was founded in 1923 through the merger of the School of Medicine (established 1903) and the Institute of Law (established 1913). Until 1958 it was named the Syrian University, but the name changed after the founding of the University of Aleppo. There are nine public universities and more than ten private ones in Syria. Damascus University was one of the most reputable universities in the Middle East before the war in Syria started in 2011.

The University of Damascus consists of several faculties, higher Institutes, intermediate institutes and a school of nursing. One of the institutions specializes in teaching the Arabic language to foreigners, which is the largest institution of its kind in the Arab world.

CATEGORIES: Communes in Aude

La Force is a commune of 222 people (2017). It is in the region Occitanie in the Aude department in the south of France.

Montclar is a commune of 171 people (2017). It is in the region Occitanie in the Aude department in the south of France.

[[Isabel Abedi]]

CATEGORIES: German people, German writers

Isabel Nasrin Abedi (born March 3, 1967 in Munich) is a German children's and youth book writer.

[[Carroll County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Carroll County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 167,134. Its county seat is Westminster.

[[Dorchester County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Dorchester County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 32,618. Its county seat is Cambridge. The county was formed in 1669 and named for the Earl of Dorset, a family friend of the Calverts (the founding family of the Maryland colony).

[[Cumberland, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Maryland, County seats in Maryland

Cumberland is a city in the U.S. state of Maryland. It is the county seat of Allegany County. As of the 2010 census, the city's population was 20,859.

[[Roquefeuil, Aude]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Aude

Roquefeuil is a commune of 289 people (2017). It is in the region Occitanie in the Aude department in the south of France.

[[Garrett County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Garrett County is the westernmost county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the population was 30,097, making it the third-smallest populous county in Maryland. Its county seat is Oakland.

[[Harford County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

right|200pxHarford County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. The county had a population of 244,826 people during the 2010 census. Its county seat is Bel Air.

Howard County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 287,085. Its county seat is Ellicott City.

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Kent County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 20,197, making it the smallest populous county in Maryland. Its county seat is Chestertown.

[[Queen Anne's County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Queen Anne's County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. The county had a population of 47,798 people in the 2010 census. Its county seat is Centreville.

[[Saint Mary's County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: 1630s establishments in the Thirteen Colonies, 1637 establishments, Maryland counties

Saint Mary's County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 105,151. Its county seat is Leonardtown. The county was formed on January 24, 1637.

Somerset County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 26,470. Its county seat is Princess Anne.

[[Talbot County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Talbot County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 37,782. Its county seat is Easton.

[[Washington County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Maryland counties

Washington County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 147,430. Its county seat is Hagerstown.

[[Wicomico County, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: 19th-century establishments in Maryland, 1867 establishments in the United States, Maryland counties

Wicomico County is a county located in the southeastern part of the U.S. state of Maryland, on the Delmarva Peninsula. As of the 2010 census, the county's population was 98,733. Its county seat is Salisbury. The county was named after the Wicomico River. It was created in 1867.

[[Three Rivers]]

CATEGORIES: 2000s American drama television series, 2010s American drama television series, English-language television programs

Three Rivers is an American medical drama TV series that ran on CBS from 2009 to 2010.

[[Bloodhounds of Broadway (1952 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 comedy movies, 1950s musical movies, American comedy movies, American musical movies, Movies based on short stories, Movies directed by Harmon Jones

Bloodhounds of Broadway is a 1952 American musical comedy movie. It was directed by Harmon Jones. The movie is based on the story of the same name by Damon Runyon. Actors include Mitzi Gaynor, Mitzi Green, Scott Brady, Marguerite Chapman, and Wally Vernon. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox. It was remade in 1989.

[[A Farewell to Arms (1957 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 drama movies, 1950s war movies, 1950s romantic drama movies, American romantic drama movies, World War I movies, Movies based on books, American movie remakes, Movies directed by John Huston, Movies directed by Charles Vidor

A Farewell to Arms is a 1957 World War I romantic drama movie. It was directed by Charles Vidor. The movie is based on novel of the same name by Ernest Hemmingway. It is a remake of the 1932 movie of the same name. It stars Rock Hudson, Jennifer Jones, Vittorio De Sica, and Elaine Stritch. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox. The movie was nominated for an Academy Award in 1958.

[[Gil Schwartz]]

CATEGORIES: American columnists, 1951 births, 2020 deaths, American novelists, Businesspeople from New York City, Journalists from New York City, People from New Rochelle, New York, Deaths from myocardial infarction

Gil Schwartz (May 20, 1951 – May 2, 2020), known by his pen name Stanley Bing, was an American business humorist and novelist. He wrote a column for Fortune magazine for more than twenty years. He also worked forEsquire magazine. He was the author of thirteen books, including What Would Machiavelli Do? and ''The Curriculum'.

Schwartz was senior executive vice president of corporate communications and Chief Communications Officer for CBS.

Bing was born in New York City. He was raised in New Rochelle, New York. Bing studied at Brandeis University. Schwartz died on May 2, 2020 at his home in Santa Monica, California from a heart attack. He was 68.

[[Prime Minister of Myanmar]]

CATEGORIES: Prime Ministers of Myanmar

The Prime Minister of Myanmar is the head of the government of Myanmar and the chief executive authority of the national government. The prime minister is also the commander in chief of the Armed Forces.

The office ended on 30 March 2011, according to the current Constitution of Myanmar (adopted in 2008). It said that the president is both the head of state and head of government. however, the military coup of 2021 put the Chairman of the State Administration Council into the highest position. He is the de facto head of government, and the president is now the nominal head of state.

The office was created again on 1 August 2021 with Min Aung Hlaing forming a caretaker government.

[[Fire Down Below (1957 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 movies, 1950s adventure movies, American adventure movies, British adventure movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Robert Parrish

Fire Down Below is a 1957 American British adventure movie. It was directed by Robert Parrish. The movie is based on the 1954 novel of the same name by Max Catto. Actors include Rita Hayworth, Jack Lemmon, Robert Mitchum, Herbert Lom, Edric Connor, Peter Illing, and Anthony Newley. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[President of Myanmar]]

CATEGORIES: Presidents of Myanmar

The president of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar (နိုင်ငံတော်‌ သမ္မတ) is the head of state and head of government of Myanmar.

The president is elected by members of parliament, not by the general population. The Presidential Electoral College, a three committee body, elects the president.

[[Khin Nyunt]]

CATEGORIES: 1939 births, Living people, Generals, Prime Ministers of Myanmar

General Khin Nyunt (ခင်ညွန့်; kʰɪ̀ɰ̃ ɲʊ̰ɰ̃; born 11 October 1939) is a Burmese military officer and politician. He was the 9th Prime Minister of Myanmar from 25 August 2003 until 18 October 2004.

[[A Guide for the Married Man]]

CATEGORIES: 1967 comedy movies, American comedy movies

A Guide for the Married Man is a 1967 American comedy movie. It was directed by Gene Kelly. Actors include Walter Matthau, Inger Stevens, Sue Ann Langdon, Claire Kelly, Jayne Mansfield, Sid Caesar, Carl Reiner, Art Carney, Jack Benny, and Terry-Thomas. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Frederick Kroesen]]

CATEGORIES: 1923 births, 2020 deaths, American generals, American military personnel of World War II, American military personnel of the Korean War, American military personnel of the Vietnam War, People from New Jersey

Frederick James Kroesen, Jr. (February 11, 1923 – April 30, 2020) was a United States Army four-star general. He was born in Phillipsburg, New Jersey.

Kroesen was the Commanding General of the Seventh United States Army and the commander of NATO Central Army Group from 1979 to 1983, and Commanding General, United States Army Forces Command from 1976 to 1978. 

He also was Vice Chief of Staff of the Army from 1978 to 1979. He commanded troops in World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War.

Kroesen died on April 30, 2020 in Alexandria, Virginia, aged 97.

[[Richard Thomas (actor)]]

CATEGORIES: Emmy Award winning actors, 1951 births, American child actors, American movie actors, American stage actors, American television actors, American voice actors, American television directors, American television producers, Living people, Actors from New York City

Richard Earl Thomas (born June 13, 1951) is an American actor. He was born in New York City.

He is best known for his leading role as author John-Boy Walton in the CBS drama The Waltons, for which he won one Emmy Award and received nominations for another Emmy Award and two Golden Globe Awards. 

He also starred in Stephen King's miniseries It and played Special Agent Frank Gaad on FX's spy thriller series The Americans.

[[Welcome to Hard Times]]

CATEGORIES: 1967 movies, 1960s western movies, American western movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Burt Kennedy

Welcome to Hard Times is a 1967 American western movie. It was directed by Burt Kennedy. The movie was based on the book with the same name by E. L. Doctorow. Actors include Henry Fonda, Warren Oates, Janis Paige, Keenan Wynn, Lon Chaney Jr., Aldo Ray, and Janice Rule. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

[[Barbara Barrie]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, American novelists, Actors from Chicago, Writers from Chicago, Singers from Chicago

Barbara Barrie (born Barbara Ann Berman, May 23, 1931) is an American actress, singer and author. She was born in Chicago. She is best known for her role as Evelyn Stoller in Breaking Away. She was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress in 1979.

[[Hans Conried]]

CATEGORIES: 1917 births, 1982 deaths, Deaths from myocardial infarction, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American radio actors, American voice actors, Actors from Baltimore, Maryland, Comedians from Maryland

Hans Georg Conried Jr. (April 15, 1917spaced ndashJanuary 5, 1982) was an American actor and comedian. He was born in Baltimore, Maryland.

Conried voiced George Darling and Captain Hook in Peter Pan (1953), Snidely Whiplash in Jay Ward's Dudley Do-Right cartoons, Professor Waldo P. Wigglesworth in Ward's Hoppity Hooper cartoons, and Professor Kropotkin on the radio and movie versions of My Friend Irma. 

He also appeared as Uncle Tonoose on Danny Thomas' sitcom Make Room for Daddy, and in multiple roles on I Love Lucy.

Conried died in Burbank, California on January 5, 1982 of a heart attack, aged 64.

[[Ben Hoekendijk]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, 2020 deaths, Christian writers, Dutch journalists, Dutch Protestants, Dutch sportspeople, Evangelists, Pentecostals, Sailors, Writers from Utrecht (province)

Ben Hoekendijk (30 June 1938 – 1 May 2020) was a Dutch speaker, evangelist and pastor. Hoekendijk was born in Baarn. He was the founder and director of the Opwekking Foundation. He was an important person in the Dutch Pentecostal movement.

After serious problems Hoekendijk applied himself to sea sailing and sports journalism. He wrote a lot of books about sea sailing.

Hoekendijk died in Harderwijk on 1 May 2020, aged 81.

[[Nancy Stark Smith]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from ovarian cancer, American dancers, Writers from New York City

Nancy Stark Smith (1952 – May 1, 2020) was an American dancer. She was a founding participant in Contact Improvisation. Smith was born in New York City. 

She worked with many partners including Steve Paxton, Julyen Hamilton, Karen Nelson, and Mike Vargas.

In 1975, she founded Contact Quarterly, an international journal of dance and improvisation.

Smith died on May 1, 2020 from ovarian cancer in Florence, Massachusetts at the age of 68.

[[Will Theunissen]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 births, 2020 deaths, Dutch musicians, Guitarists, People from Nijmegen

Will Theunissen (30 June 1954 – 1 May 2020) was a Dutch guitarist. He was born in Nijmegen. Theunissen was the founder of the Jazz Rock band Elevator from Nijmegen, which was active in the 1970s.

Together with Frank Boeijen he was from the beginning part of the Frank Boeijen Groep, becoming notable in the 1980s.

His best known songs were Doe Iets, Zwart Wit and 1.000.000 Sterren of the album Kontakt (1984). They reached the Dutch Top 40.

Theunissen died in Tiel on 1 May 2020, aged 65.

[[Erik Tandberg (space educator)]]

CATEGORIES: 1932 births, 2020 deaths, Norwegian scientists, Engineers, Norwegian television personalities, Norwegian educators, Writers from Oslo, Politicians from Oslo

Erik Tandberg (October 19, 1932 – May 2, 2020) was a Norwegian engineer, politician, author, television personality and space educator. He was born in Oslo, Norway. He worked with Norwegian Space Centre. Tandberg was a member of the City Council of Oslo for the Conservative Party from 1969 to 1989.

Tandberg died on May 2, 2020 in Oslo at the age of 87.

[[Tony Roberts (actor)]]

CATEGORIES: 1939 births, Actors from New York City, American movie actors, American voice actors, American stage actors, American television actors, Living people

David Anthony "Tony" Roberts (born October 22, 1939) is an American actor. He is known for his roles in six Woody Allen movies. His best known role was in Annie Hall.

[[Julie Cobb]]

CATEGORIES: 1947 births, Living people, American movie actors, American stage actors, American television actors, American voice actors, Actors from Los Angeles, California

Julie Frances Cobb (born May 29, 1947) is an American actress. She was born in Los Angeles. Cobb's father was actor Lee J. Cobb.

From 1976 to 1977, she was married to actor Victor French. From 1986 to 2005, she was married to actor James Cromwell.

Her movie roles include in The Second Coming of Suzanne (1974), Fantasy Island (1978), Just You and Me, Kid (1979), The Runnin' Kind (1989), Lisa (1990), Defending Your Life (1991) and Dr. Jekyll and Ms. Hyde (1995). 

She also appeared in the TV movie versions of Salem's Lot (1979) and Brave New World (1980). She also starred in Arthur Miller's play After the Fall.

[[Victor French]]

CATEGORIES: 1934 births, 1989 deaths, Deaths from lung cancer, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, American television directors, American television producers, Movie directors from California, Movie producers from California, Actors from California, People from Santa Barbara, California

Victor Edwin French (December 4, 1934 – June 15, 1989) was an American actor and director. He was known for his roles on the television programs Little House on the Prairie, Highway to Heaven and Carter Country. He was born in Santa Barbara, California. 

French died on June 15, 1989 in Los Angeles from lung cancer, aged 54.

[[Red Skies of Montana]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 drama movies, 1950s adventure movies, American adventure movies, American drama movies, Movies based on books, Movies directed by Joseph M. Newman

Red Skies of Montana is a 1952 American adventure drama movie. It was directed by Joseph M. Newman. It is based on the 1948 book Fire by George R. Stewart. Actors include Richard Widmark, Warren Stevens, Constance Smith, Jeffrey Hunter, and Richard Boone. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Castro Valley, California]]

CATEGORIES: Census-designated places in California, Settlements in Alameda County, California

Castro Valley is a census-designated place (CDP) in Alameda County, California, United States. As of the 2010 census, it is the fifth most populous unincorporated area in California and the twenty-third most populous in the United States. The population was 61,388 at the 2010 census.

Actors include Anne Bancroft, Margaret Leighton, Flora Robson, Betty Field, and Sue Lyon. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

The Largue river forms the eastern border of the commune.

[[Aubignosc]]

Aubignosc is a commune in the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region of south-eastern France.

Aubignosc is in the west of the Durance valley. There are the hamlets of Les Jardins and Le Forest.

The Vanson Forest is found in the north, south, and east.

== References == 

[[Auzet]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Alpes-de-Haute-Provence

 Auzet  is a French commune in the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region of south-eastern France.

There are the hamlets of L'Infernet, L'Infernet Haut, and L'Infernet Bas north of the village. The commune is very rugged with snow-capped mountains and forested slopes with 1,168 hectares of forest.

[[Acy-Romance]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Ardennes

Acy-Romance is a commune in the Ardennes department in the Grand Est region of northern France.

[[Cady Groves]]

CATEGORIES: 1989 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from natural causes in the United States, American singer-songwriters, American pop singers, American country singers, American rock singers, Singers from Oklahoma, Writers from Oklahoma

Cady Groves (July 30, 1989 – May 2, 2020) was an American singer-songwriter. She was born in Marlow, Oklahoma. Her best known songs were "This Little Girl", "Oh Darlin'", "Forget You", and "Love Actually". She released four EPs: A Month of Sundays (2009), This Little Girl (2010), Life of a Pirate (2012), and Dreams (2015).

Groves died of natural causes in Nashville, Tennessee on May 2, 2020 at the age of 30.

[[Ji Chaozhu]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, Chinese politicians, Ambassadors of China

Ji Chaozhu (July 30, 1929 – April 29, 2020) was a Chinese politician. He was an English interpreter for Chairman Mao Zedong and Premier Zhou Enlai. He was the Ambassador to the Court of St. James's (United Kingdom); and lastly as an Undersecretary General of the United Nations. He retired in 1996.

[[Lee Roy West]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, American lawyers, American judges, Politicians from Oklahoma, US Democratic Party politicians

Lee Roy West (November 26, 1929 – April 24, 2020) was an American politician and lawyer. He was the Senior United States District Judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Oklahoma. He was nominated to the court by President Jimmy Carter in 1979. West was born in Clayton, Oklahoma.

West died on April 24, 2020 in Muskogee, Oklahoma at the age of 90.

[[Heda Čechová]]

CATEGORIES: 1928 births, 2020 deaths, Czech politicians, Entertainers from Prague, Radio personalities, Television news anchors

Heda Čechová (July 17, 1928 – April 23, 2020) was a Czech television anchorwoman, radio presenter, and politician. She was a member of the Czech National Council for the Civic Forum from 1990 until 1992 following the Velvet Revolution and Czechoslovakia's transition to democracy. She was born in Prague. 

Čechová died on April 23, 2020 in Prague, at the age of 91.

[[Jack McCall, Desperado]]

CATEGORIES: 1953 movies, 1950s western movies, American western movies, Movies directed by Sidney Salkow

Jack McCall, Desperado is a 1953 American western movie. It was directed by Sidney Salkow. The movie stars George Montgomery, Angela Stevens, Douglas Kennedy, and Eugene Iglesias. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[The Quick Gun]]

CATEGORIES: 1964 movies, American western movies, Movies based on short stories, Movies directed by Sidney Salkow

The Quick Gun is a 1964 American western movie. It was directed by Sidney Salkow. The movie is based on the short story The Fastest Gun by Steve Fisher. It stars Audie Murphy, Walter Sande, Merry Anders, and Ted de Corsia. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[Rohanpur A. B. Government High School]]

CATEGORIES: 20th century establishments in Bangladesh, 1930s establishments in Asia, 1939 establishments, Schools in Bangladesh

Rohanpur A.b. Govt. High School also known as Rohanpur Ahmadi Begum Government High School is an school in Gomastapur, Chapai Nawabganj.

[[Inferno (1953 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1953 drama movies, 1950s crime movies, 1950s romantic drama movies, American romantic drama movies, Movies directed by Roy Ward Baker, Movies set in deserts

Inferno is a 1953 American romantic crime drama movie. It was directed by Roy Ward Baker. Actors include Robert Ryan, Rhonda Fleming, William Lundigan, Larry Keating, and Henry Hull. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox. It was remade in 1973 as Ordeal.

[[John Hospers]]

CATEGORIES: 1918 births, 2011 deaths, American philosophers, American political activists, American political writers, Writers from Iowa, Politicians from Iowa, US Libertarian Party politicians

John Hospers (June 9, 1918 – June 12, 2011) was an American philosopher and political activist. He was once a friend of the philosopher Ayn Rand.

In 1972, Hospers became the first presidential candidate of the Libertarian Party, and was the only minor party candidate to receive an electoral vote in that year's U.S. presidential election.

[[Feelings (1974 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1974 drama movies, British drama movies

Feelings is a 1974 British drama movie. It was directed by Gerry O'Hara. Actors include Kate O'Mara, Edward Peel, Paul Freeman, Bob Sherman, and Beth Porter.

[[Uenuku]]

CATEGORIES: Maori, Gods and goddesses

Uenuku is a god of rainbows and important ancestor in Māori oral histories. Uenuku simply means 'rainbow'.

Uenuku is special to the Ngāpuhi, Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Porou, Ngāi Tahu, and Ngāi Tūhoe Māori tribes. He is also known to two groups of tribes called Kurahaupō and Tainui. The Te Arawa group of tribes also know of him. Some of these tribes may also say he is a god of war.

Geoff Murphy made his first movie in 1974, which was based on Uenuku's story. It was the first TV drama to be entirely spoken in the Māori language.

[[Lady Liberty (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1971 comedy movies, French comedy movies, Italian comedy movies, Movies directed by Mario Monicelli

Lady Liberty (Italian: La mortadella) is a 1971 Italian French comedy movie. It was directed by Mario Monicelli. Actors include Sophia Loren, William Devane, Susan Sarandon, Danny DeVito, and Gigi Proietti. It was distributed by United Artists.

[[Ibrahim Muhammad Abu Arab]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, 2014 deaths

Ibrahim Muhammad Abu Arab (Arabic: إبراهيم محمد صالح; 1931, Nazareth - March 3, 2014, Homs) was a Palestinian poet. -Shecera was born in the village. After the occupation of the village by the invaders, first Kefer Kana, then moved to Arrabetu'l-Butuf. After staying there for two months, he emigrated to Lebanon and then to Syria.

The poet's father, Abu Arab, was killed in 1948 by Zionist groups who had invaded Palestine. In 1982, the son was killed by Israeli forces during the occupation of Lebanon. As a child, he witnessed the Palestinian Revolution against the British occupation and Jewish emigration. He was known as Abu Arab, the Poet of the Palestinian Revolution, and the Poet of the Palestinian Camp. He died on March 3, 2014 in Homs.

[[Phffft!]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 comedy movies, 1950s romantic comedy movies, American romantic comedy movies, Movies based on plays, Movies directed by Mark Robson, Movies about divorce

Phffft! is a 1954 American romantic comedy movie. It was directed by Mark Robson. The movie is based on the play by George Axelrod. Actors include Judy Holliday, Jack Lemmon, Jack Carson, Kim Novak, Donald Curtis, Luella Gear, and Donald Randolph. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures.

[[It Should Happen to You]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 comedy movies, 1950s romantic comedy movies, American romantic comedy movies, Movies directed by George Cukor

It Should Happen to You is a 1954 American romantic comedy movie. It was directed by George Cukor. Actors include Judy Holliday, Jack Lemmon, Peter Lawford, Michael O'Shea, and Wendy Barrie. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures. It was nominated for an Academy Award in 1955.

[[Lady and Gent]]

CATEGORIES: 1932 movies, 1930s drama movies, American sports drama movies

Lady and Gent is a 1932 American sports drama movie. It was directed by Stephen Roberts. Actors include George Bancroft, Wynne Gibson, Charles Starrett, John Wayne, and James Gleason. It was distributed by Paramount Pictures and was remade as Unmarried in 1939.

[[Osmoregulation]]

CATEGORIES: Cell biology, Metabolism

Osmoregulation is the maintenance of constant osmotic pressure in the fluids of an organism by the control of water and salt concentrations.

Kidneys play a very large role in human osmoregulation by regulating the amount of water reabsorbed from glomerular filtrate in kidney tubules, which is controlled by hormones such as antidiuretic hormone (ADH), aldosterone, and angiotensin II. For example, a decrease in water potential is detected by osmoreceptors in the hypothalamus, which stimulates ADH release from the pituitary gland to increase the permeability of the walls of the collecting ducts in the kidneys. Therefore, a large proportion of water is reabsorbed from fluid in the kidneys to prevent too much water from being excreted.

[[Will Gluck]]

CATEGORIES: American movie directors, American screenwriters, American television producers, American television writers, Movie producers from New York, Screenwriters from New York City, Year of birth missing (living people), Cornell University alumni, Living people

Will Gluck is an American director known for directing Friends with Benefits and Peter Rabbit movies.

[[Friends with Benefits]]

CATEGORIES: 2011 romance movies, 2011 comedy movies, English-language movies, 2010s romantic comedy movies, 2010s sex comedy movies, American romantic comedy movies, American sex comedy movies, Movies directed by Will Gluck, Movies set in Los Angeles, California, Movies set in New York City

Friends with Benefits is a 2011 comedy romantic movie directed by Will Gluck and starring Mila Kunis and Justin Timberlake.

The movie was very positively welcomed from audience who praised its story, characters, humor, performances, soundtrack and emotional weight. It was also a commercial success grossing $150.4 million.

[[Outlaw's Daughter]]

CATEGORIES: 1954 movies, American western movies

Outlaw's Daughter is a 1954 American western movie. It was directed by Wesley Berry. Actors include Bill Williams, Jim Davis, George Cleveland, Nelson Leigh, and Elisha Cook Jr.. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Aston Merrygold]]

CATEGORIES: British R&B musicians, British soul musicians, English pop singers, English songwriters, Hip hop musicians, Living people, 1988 births

Aston Iain Merrygold (born 13 February 1988) is a British singer, songwriter, dancer, television personality, actor, and philanthropist. He recently appeared on the X Factor. He is part of the group JLS (an acronym for Jack the Lad Swing). 

Aston grew up in Peterborough dreaming of being a footballer. At secondary school, he represented England for the European Youth Games in 2004 but but soon after he discovered that, he had a nerve disorder in his left foot and had to give up sport. 

When Aston was 14, his mother asked him to enter Kid Stars in their eyes and appeared as Michael Jackson in 2002 singing "Rockin' Robin". Aston performed in all of his school productions and after finishing school in 2004, he was cast in a new TV show called Fun Song Factory. 

Aston met Marvin Humes whilst auditioning for a TV advert. Since joining the band, Aston moved to London to make rehearsing easier. 

Aston Merrygold and fellow members of JLS, Marvin Humes, Oritsé Williams, and JB Gill were absolutely fantastic singers and they deserved to become the number 1 boy band in the United Kingdom.

[[Sebastian (rapper)]]

CATEGORIES: American hip hop musicians, American rap musicians, American songwriters, Living people

Garland "Sebastian" Mosley, Jr. is an American rapper and songwriter. He is currently signed to Mosley Music Group. He is Timbaland's younger brother.

[[The Farmer Takes a Wife (1953 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1950s musical movies, 1953 comedy movies, American musical comedy movies, Movies based on plays, Movies directed by Henry Levin

The Farmer Takes a Wife is a 1953 American musical comedy movie. It was directed by Henry Levin. The movie and is based on 1934 play of the same name. It is a remake of the 1935 original. Actors include Betty Grable, Dale Robertson, Thelma Ritter, John Carroll, and Merry Anders. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Obie Trice]]

CATEGORIES: American hip hop musicians, American rap musicians, American songwriters, Living people, 1977 births

Obie Trice III (born 14 November 1977) is an American rapper and songwriter. He was born in Detroit, Michigan. He has been rapping since age of 23. In 2000 he was signed to Shady Records.

His first album Cheers was released in 2003 with its first single being "Got Some Teeth" The album consists of 17 tracks.

[[Prime Minister of Iceland]]

CATEGORIES: Prime Ministers of Iceland

The prime minister of Iceland (Forsætisráðherra Íslands) is Iceland's head of government. The prime minister is appointed formally by the president.

[[Kevin McCall]]

CATEGORIES: American hip hop musicians, American pop singers, American rap musicians, American record producers, American R&B singers, Living people, 1985 births

Kevin Lamar McCall Jr. (born 25 July 1985) is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, and record producer. He is signed to CBE. He wrote on "Last Train to Paris" and is nominated for a Grammy, with Chris Brown for Deuces, for the 2011's Grammy. 

[[Bjarni Benediktsson (born 1970)]]

CATEGORIES: 1970 births, Living people, People from Reykjavík, Prime Ministers of Iceland

Bjarni Benediktsson (born 26 January 1970), known as Bjarni Ben, is an Icelandic politician. He was the Prime Minister from January to November 2017. He has been the leader of the Icelandic Independence Party since 2009. He was Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs from 2013 to 2017, a post he later retained under Katrin Jakobsdottir.

[[Najaf Daryabandari]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, Iranian writers, Translators

Najaf Daryabandari (نجف دریابندری; 23 August 1929 – 4 May 2020) was an Iranian writer and translator. He was known for translating works of Ernest Hemingway, William Faulkner, Bertrand Russell, Samuel Beckett and Mark Twain into Persian. 

He started translation at the age of 17 with William Faulkner's book A Rose for Emily. He was also a writer and wrote From Garlic to Onion, a two-volume tome on Iranian cuisine. He was born in Abadan, Iran.

Daryabandari died on 4 May 2020 in Tehran at the age of 90.

[[John Ridley (footballer)]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 births, 2020 deaths, English footballers, Sportspeople from County Durham

John Ridley (27 April 1952 – 3 May 2020) was an English footballer. He had a twelve-year professional career in the English Football League. He played for Port Vale and Chesterfield, as well as Leicester City. 

He also played for non-league Stafford Rangers and for American side Fort Lauderdale Strikers.

Ridley was born in Consett, County Durham. He died on 3 May 2020, aged 68.

[[Chanut Piyaoui]]

CATEGORIES: 1924 births, 2020 deaths, People from Bangkok, Thai businesspeople

Than Phu Ying Chanut Piyaoui (ท่านผู้หญิงชนัตถ์ ปิยะอุย, 15 May 1924 – 3 May 2020) was a Thai businesswoman. She was born in Bangkok. Piyaoui was best known as the founder of Thai hospitality group Dusit International. She was the managing director and chairperson of Dusit International from 1970 to 2014.

Piyaoui died on 3 May 2020 in Bangkok, aged 95.

[[Governor-General of Grenada]]

CATEGORIES: Governors-General of Grenada

The Governor-General of Grenada has been the representative of the Grenadian monarch since the country's independence from the United Kingdom in 1974.  

[[Leo de Gale]]

CATEGORIES: 1921 births, 1986 deaths, Governors-General of Grenada

Sir Leo Victor de Gale GBR (December 28, 1921 – March 23, 1986) was the first Governor-General of Grenada, from February 7, 1974 to September 30, 1978.

[[Paul Scoon]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2013 deaths, Governors-General of Grenada

Sir Paul Godwin Scoon GBR (4 July 1935 – 2 September 2013) was Governor-General of Grenada from 1978 to 1992. He was in charge during the rise and fall of the People's Revolutionary Government and during the Invasion of Grenada.

[[Daniel Williams (governor-general)]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, Living people, Governors-General of Grenada

Sir Daniel Charles Williams GBR (born 4 November 1935) is a Grenadian politician. He was a Governor-General of Grenada, from 8 August 1996 until 27 November 2008. 

He was formally appointed by Queen Elizabeth II on 9 August 1996 after having been nominated by Prime Minister Keith Mitchell.

The Other Woman is a 1954 American crime drama movie. It was directed by Hugo Haas (who also stars). Other actors include Cleo Moore, Lance Fuller, John Qualen, and Lucille Barkley. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[List of heads of government of Grenada]]

This is a list of heads of government of Grenada, from the creation of the office of Chief Minister in 1960 to the present day.

[[Hudson Austin]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, Living people, Prime Ministers of Grenada

Hudson Austin (born 26 April 1938) is a Grenadian military official and politician. He was the Chairman of the Revolutionary Military Council of Grenada from 19 October 1983 to 25 October 1983. He is a member of the New Jewel Movement. Austin was born in the British Windward Islands. 

[[Calumet, Michigan]]

CATEGORIES: Villages in Michigan

Calumet (ˌ or ˈ KAL) is a village in Calumet Township, Houghton County, in the U.S. state of Michigan's Upper Peninsula. The population was 726 at the 2010 census. Calumet's nickname is Copper Town U.S.A.

[[Houghton County, Michigan]]

CATEGORIES: 1840s establishments in Michigan, 1846 establishments in the United States, Michigan counties

Houghton County is a county in the Upper Peninsula in the U.S. state of Michigan. As of the 2010 census, the population was 36,628. The county seat and largest city is Houghton. Both the county and the city were named for Michigan State geologist and Detroit Mayor Douglass Houghton.

[[Calumet Township, Michigan]]

CATEGORIES: Townships in Michigan

Calumet Charter Township (ˌ KAL) is a charter township of Houghton County in the U.S. state of Michigan. The population was 6,489 at the 2010 census. It is the largest township by population in Houghton County.

[[Caprice (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1967 comedy movies, 1967 thriller movies, American comedy movies, American thriller movies, Movies directed by Frank Tashlin

Caprice is a 1967 American comedy thriller movie. It was directed by Frank Tashlin. It stars Doris Day, Richard Harris, and Ray Walston. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox. The movie did not make much money in ticket sales.

[[Philomena Lee]]

CATEGORIES: 1933 births, Irish people, Activists, Living people

Annie Philomena Lee (born 24 March 1933) is an Irish nurse and activist. Her life was shown in the 2009 book The Lost Child of Philomena Lee by Martin Sixsmith. The book was made into a movie titled  Philomena (2013), which was nominated for four Academy Awards. 

Lee is now an activist and spokesperson for adoption rights. Lee has created The Philomena Project in order to raise awareness about adoption laws and find ways to improve them. 

In February 2014, she met  Pope Francis to discuss the Catholic church's adoption policies.

[[Rosalind Elias]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from congestive heart failure, American stage actors, Actors from Massachusetts, Singers from Massachusetts, People from Lowell, Massachusetts

Rosalind Elias (March 13, 1930 – May 3, 2020) was an American mezzo-soprano. She was best known for creating the role of Erika in premiere of Samuel Barber's Vanessa in 1958 and Charmian in Antony and Cleopatra by the same composer. Elias was born in Lowell, Massachusetts.

Elias died on May 3, 2020 in New York City of congestive heart failure, aged 90.

[[Night Train to Paris]]

CATEGORIES: 1964 thriller movies, American thriller movies, British thriller movies

Night Train to Paris is a 1964 American British thriller movie. It was directed by Robert Douglas. Actors include Leslie Nielsen, Aliza Gur, Dorinda Stevens, Eric Pohlmann, Jack Melford, and Hugh Latimer. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[India Adams]]

CATEGORIES: Singers from Los Angeles, California, Actors from Los Angeles, California, American stage actors, 1927 births, 2020 deaths

India Adams (March 5, 1927 – April 25, 2020) was an American singer. She was known as the ghost singer who dubbed the singing voices of Cyd Charisse and Joan Crawford in the mid-1950s. She was born in Los Angeles. She dubbed the singing voices for Charisse in The Band Wagon (1953). That same year, she also dubbed for Crawford in Torch Song.

Adams died on April 25, 2020 in Los Angeles of a short-illness, aged 93.

[[Fearless Vampire Killers]]

CATEGORIES: 1967 comedy movies, 1960s horror movies, American horror movies, American comedy movies, British horror movies, British comedy movies, Movies directed by Roman Polanski

Fearless Vampire Killers is a 1967 American British horror comedy movie. It was directed by Roman Polanski (who also stars). Other actors include Jack MacGowran, Sharon Tate, Ronald Lacey, Alfie Bass, Ferdy Mayne, and Terry Downes. It was distributed by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

[[Neuilly-sur-Seine]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Hauts-de-Seine

Neuilly-sur-Seine (nøji syʁ sɛn), known as Neuilly, is a commune in the department of Hauts-de-Seine in France. It is west of Paris. 

The city hosts many foreign headquarters and embassies. It is the richest and most expensive suburb of Paris.

Together with the 16th and 7th arrondissement of Paris, the town of Neuilly-sur-Seine forms the richest residential area in the whole of France.

[[Phil Goff]]

CATEGORIES: 1953 births, Living people, Mayors, Leaders of the Opposition (New Zealand)

Philip Bruce Goff NZL (born 22 June 1953) is a New Zealand politician. In 2016, he became the 2nd Mayor of Auckland. He was a Member of the New Zealand Parliament from 1981 to 1990 and again from 1993 to 2016. 

He was Leader of the Labour Party and Leader of the Opposition between 11 November 2008 and 13 December 2011.

[[Jeremy Bingham]]

CATEGORIES: 1936 births, Living people, Australian businesspeople, Politicians from Sydney

Jeremy Bingham (born 16 March 1936) is an Australian property businessman and Citizens' Reform Association politician. He was Lord Mayor of Sydney and an Alderman of the Sydney City Council from 1974 to 1991. He also was a member of the Hunter's Hill Municipal Council from 1965 to 1971. He was born in Gosford, New South Wales.

[[Madara Uchiha]]

CATEGORIES: Naruto characters

Madara Uchiha is a fictional character from the manga series Naruto, which depicts a world of ninjas.  One of the main villains of the Naruto series (Part II), he is one of the co-founders of the Hidden Leaf Village along with friend/rival Hashirama Senju, the First Hokage.

[[Cherry Blossom (candy)]]

CATEGORIES: Chocolate, Candy

Cherry Blossom is a type of chocolate sold in Canada and made by Hershey Canada Inc. Hershey used to make it at its Canadian manufacturing facility in Smiths Falls, Ontario.

The candy was made from the 1890s by the Walter M. Lowney Company of Canada until Hershey took it over as a subsidiary brand. The factory in Smiths Falls, which is north-east of Kingston, Ontario, is now closed.

The candy consists of a maraschino cherry and cherry syrup surrounded by a mixture of chocolate, shredded coconut and roasted peanut pieces. The candy is sold in a wrapped 45-gram portion, packaged in a close-fitting cardboard box.

Despite common belief, filling is not injected inside the chocolate.  The cherry candy is covered with an enzyme, invertase, that breaks down the solid into a liquid over the next 1 to 2 weeks.

The candy contains 210 calories of food energy, 10g fat (15% daily intake), 29g carbohydrate (10% daily intake), 1g fibre (4% daily intake), 27g sugars and 2g of protein.

UPC number: 0 68000 70227 0

[[Moroccan architecture]]

CATEGORIES: Moroccan culture, Architecture

Moroccan architecture includes various structures built during different time periods. from the first Berberians settlers from the south and through the Arab invastion from the east and the European conquest that came from the north. The most notable style in this country is the Berberian Architecture that existed initially, followed by the style of local Islamic architecture that shaped the local style that came after the Arabs entered.

[[Persian architecture]]

CATEGORIES: Iran, Architecture

Persian architecture or Iranian architecture is the name of the Architecture style of Iran from the Pre-Islamic period until the Islamic period of today. this type of architecture style including also the Persian Garden style.

[[Catalan navy]]

CATEGORIES: Navies, Pages with unreviewed translations

The Catalan navy - with Catalan ships, Catalan admirals and Catalan crew (not counting the rabble) - under the direct or indirect orders of the counts of Barcelona, represented a reality recognized by the entire Mediterranean from its origins to Fernando the Catholic. In later times ships built and manned on the Catalan coasts, under the authority of non-Catalan kings, for example the kings of Naples, carried out some important events.

Similarly, the navies of the kingdoms of Mallorca and Valencia had their own entity and could be studied separately

[[Hydrilla]]

CATEGORIES: Aquatic plants

Hydrilla is a genus of aquatic plant. It contains only one species Hydrilla verticillata. Some botanists divide it into different species. It is a submersed plant. It can grow to the surface and form dense mats. It can form in all types of water bodies. Hydrilla stems are slender, branched up to 25 feet long. Hydrilla’s small leaves are strap-like.

[[Flávio Migliaccio]]

CATEGORIES: 1934 births, 2020 deaths, Suicides by hanging, Brazilian movie actors, Brazilian movie directors, Brazilian screenwriters, People from São Paulo

Flávio Migliaccio (26 August 1934 – 4 May 2020) was a Brazilian actor, movie director and screenwriter. He was born in São Paulo, Brazil.

He appeared in more than 90 movies and television shows between 1958 and 2019. His 1962 movie The Beggars is thought to be his best known work. An actor, he starred in My Home is Copacabana and in The Hour and Turn of Augusto Matraga. 

Migliaccio hung himself at his farm in Rio Bonito, Brazil on 4 May 2020, aged 85.

[[Kiss Me Deadly]]
